page.title: 01REVIEW OF THE BLOCK
page.content: The{three villages of Cropwell Butler, {Tithby and Wiverton}in the Trent Valley were recorded in the Domesday Book, 1086. Their individual development is here described. The dominance of Cropwell Butler is revealed by the accounts of its{ {Village Hall}and many groups which assemble there. The large commuter population of Cropwell Butler is revealed by the page on{housing,}as is the importance of the Methodist Church at Cropwell Butler, illuminated by the page on{Worship.}Future developments in the area are forshadowed in the account of{conservation,}and the discovery of oil at Cropwell Butler.
